[[Cedarville, Michigan]], [[US]] |death_date = |origin = US |instrument = [[Synthesizer]], [[Drum kit|drums]] |genre = [[Florida breaks]], [[Breakbeat]] |occupation = [[Disc jockey]], [[Record producer]], [[Remix]]er{{cite web |url= http://dancemusic.about.com/cs/interviews/a/SharazInt.htm|title= Interview with Sharaz|accessdate=2008-08-17|publisher=About.com}} |years_active = 1998â2005, 2010-present |label = Nine Four One Electro |website = [http://www.dropthatbass.com/ www.dropthatbass.com] }} Sharaz is a [[DJ]] and [[electronica]] producer in the [[Bradenton, FL]] area who is known for many national [[remixes]], especially in the form of [[Florida breaks]] and [[breakbeat]]. He is originally from East Chicago, but in 1986 moved to Florida to attend College. His current company is NineFourOne Media and he holds a [[private pilot]] license. His influences are largely soul/funk but also include: [[Eddie Kendricks]], [[Isaac Hayes]], [[Candi Staton]], [[Otis Redding]], [[Elvis Presley]], [[Zapp]], [[The Stylistics]], [[O'Jays]], [[Bill Withers]], [[Lyrics Born]], [[Sparlha Swa]], [[Slave]], [[Midnight Star]], [[Stevie Wonder]] (pre-1980), [[Al Green]], etc. Some of his notable remixes: La Roux,{{cite web |url= http://soundcloud.com/dj-sharaz/clip-la-roux-in-for-the-kill-sharazs-sleep-when-youre-dead-vip-remix|title= Remix Reference | accessdate=2011-03-26|publisher=[[SoundCloud]] }} Aquasky vs. Masterblaster, Everything But The Girl, [[Robin Fox]]{{cite web |url= http://www.discogs.com/release/74527|title= Discog.com Reference | accessdate=2008-08-17|publisher=discogs.com}} (''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''), [[Afrika Bambaataa]],{{cite web |url= http://www.remixmag.com/artists/remix_return_funk_renegade/|title= Afrika Bambaataa, RETURN OF THE FUNK RENEGADE | accessdate=2008-08-17|publisher=Remix Magazine}}{{cite web |url= http://top40-charts.com/news.php?nid=9921&string=Gary|title= Afrika Bambaataa releases new album 'Dark Matter: Moving At The Speed Of Light' | accessdate=2008-08-17|publisher=Top40-charts.com}} Fannypack,{{cite web |url= http://www.discogs.com/release/237716|title= Discog.com Reference | accessdate=2008-08-17|publisher=discogs.com}} [[Fierce Ruling Diva]] "You Gotta Believe" (''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' number 1 single{{cite web |url= http://www.fiercerulingdiva.com/index.php?name=News&file=article&sid=58|title= Billboard Chart | accessdate=2008-08-18|publisher=fiercerulingdiva.com}}) He has performed alongside acts such as Richard "Humpty" Vission, [[DJ Mea]], [[Darude]], [[DJ Rap]], [[The Warp Brothers]], [[The Bassbin Twins]], [[Paul Oakenfold]], [[DJ Baby Anne]], Storm (UK), [[Dave London]], [[D:Fuse]], [[The Crystal Method]], [[Reid Speed]], and [[DJ Icey]]. In 2007, Sharaz's track "Holdin' On" was nominated for an [[IDMA]] (International Dance Music Award) award for Best Breaks/Electro track{{cite web |url= http://www.wintermusicconference.com/events/idmas/idmawinners2007.htm|title= IDMA Nominee List, 2007 | accessdate=2008-08-17|publisher=Wintermusicconference.com}} along with [[Jamiroquai]], Bodyrox, Outwork f/Mr. Gee and [[Fedde Le Grand]]. Fedde Le Grand went on to win this category with his single "[[Put Your Hands Up 4 Detroit]]". Although primarily a breakbeat producer, Sharaz will often incorporate different genres into his production such as [[house music]] and, more recently, [[rocktronica]] and [[dubstep]]. Sharaz has been nominated several times as "America's Favorite DJ" in the [[breakbeat]] category by [[BPM (magazine)]] Sharaz has 35 records and five compact discs released. Remixes have been provided by Sharaz for Tommy Boy Records, POD Music, Kaleidoscope, DBI records, and StreetBeat Records. In August 2009, Sharaz began releasing a bi-weekly online mixcast in MP3 downloadable format entitled "Return to Planet Boom".{{cite web |url= http://soundcloud.com/dj-sharaz|title= Mixcast Reference | accessdate=2009-09-29|publisher=[[SoundCloud]] }} In early 2010, after a several year hiatus (from approx 2006 - 2010), Sharaz began producing and releasing new tracks again via [[Soundcloud]], [[Beatport]] and [[iTunes]]. ==CD Discography== DJ SHARAZ "ILL BEHAVIOR" CD (CD-01) Released July 1, 1999 10 Track UNMIXED CD.
